This is what one-year of a Biden Administration got us. None of it is good for our country.

Yesterday Biden said the report card of his first year in office is “pretty good.” That’s laughably out of touch.

Joe Biden gets an F, for failure, on every single issue he’s touched.

Biden pushed the most damaging legislation in American history that would have killed American energy jobs, raised taxes on middle-class families, and made an already historic inflation crisis worse.

Thankfully that bill is dead. It should never be revived.

In an assault on basic medical freedom and personal choice, Biden imposed an unconstitutional vaccine mandate on businesses and healthcare workers, forcing people to choose between their jobs or the vaccine.

Biden is directly responsible for the disastrous withdrawal in Afghanistan that led to the deaths of 13 Americans and countless allies. 

Biden’s feckless foreign policy has emboldened authoritarians like Putin and Xi Jinping.
Instead of addressing rising crime across the country, Joe Biden’s FBI decided to target parents who are rightly concerned about what their kids are learning in school.

Inflation surged to 6.8% in 2021, an invisible tax on Americans that’s forcing people to pay more for everyday goods.

Meanwhile, Biden’s first year in office erased 3 years of real wage growth for American families.

Biden created the worst border crisis in decades when he rolled back Trump’s border security policies. More than 1.7 MILLION illegal immigrants crossed our border during his FIRST YEAR. 

November saw the highest number of crossings ever for that month, a 300% spike from 2019.

Biden began his administration with an assault on the American energy industry by shutting down pipelines and banning drilling on federal lands and waters, threatening millions of jobs nationwide and hundreds of thousands in my home state of Texas.

Today marks one year since Joe Biden was sworn in. It’s safe to say this is the worst first year of a presidency in modern history.

We’ve seen our energy industry attacked, our medical freedom infringed upon, and our standing on the world stage diminished.

SCOTUS failed to strike down Biden’s unconstitutional mandate on healthcare workers, saying that the law doesn’t *explicitly* say healthcare workers can’t be fired for their vax status.

So I wrote a bill making it explicit: No Mandates for Healthcare Workers Act. https://t.co/fdniXmURhT

I’m going to introduce the No Mandates for Healthcare Workers Act, which would make this point clear to HHS that they do not have the power to enforce unilateral vaccine mandates on our healthcare workers.
I agree with Justice Thomas and am going to keep fighting. Since the Court has decided Congress has been ambiguous on this point, we’re going to make it clear.

The great Justice Thomas disagreed, saying if Congress wanted to give HHS broad vaccination power, it would have given HHS one. 

Instead the Majority found this authority in "definitional provisions.. and a provision regarding long-term care facilities’ sanitation procedures.”
Within a “hodgepodge of statutes” the Majority decided Congress has given enough authority to the President to regulate workers at healthcare facilities that accept Medicare or Medicaid.

So how did the Court get a different interpretation when it came to healthcare workers?

Largely, because you would be hard-pressed to find a hospital or nursing home that takes no money from Medicare or Medicaid.

“Permitting OSHA to regulate the hazards of daily life — simply because most Americans have jobs and face those same risks while on the clock — would significantly expand OSHA’s regulatory authority without clear congressional authorization”

But a broad vaccine mandate on businesses is different than the specific, setting-based workplace safety standards. 

The Court agreed, and said Congress “has not given that agency the power to regulate public health more broadly.”

OSHA sets occupational safety standards based on hazards a person might face in their individual job. 

A lineman climbing a tower or a welder on an oil rig face different hazards.

Congress gave OSHA the power to set specific safety standards for both.

This week, the Supreme Court blocked one vaccine mandate but upheld another. Both are equally harmful to the economy and to getting back to normal. 

So what’s the difference? It came down to the basic question: did Congress give the President the authority to do it?

BREAKING: The Supreme Court BLOCKS Joe Biden’s unconstitutional vaccine mandate on businesses. But it upheld his vaccine mandate on health care workers. 

We can’t stop fighting until the ENTIRE vaccine mandate is thrown into the garbage heap of history where it belongs.
We can't afford any more of Biden's bad policy - literally. https://t.co/HHya6Hlvnx

Any Republican who voted against HR 550 voted *against* putting guardrails on an *existing* Biden program. 

They didn’t vote against a new database (there’s no new database). They voted against protecting your privacy under a federal government program that’s already underway.

Republicans were rightly worried about this, which is why HR 550 was crafted with clear privacy safeguards to correct it.

We didn’t want authoritarian blue-state governors transmitting personal vaccination information to the CDC, or have a hacker steal personal vaccine data.

That’s where HR 550 comes in - it is explicitly designed to “improve data security and privacy protection.”

Again, when Biden enacted ARP, there were no privacy protections. This bill requires privacy protections that were nonexistent in the Biden plan.
https://t.co/ZBUqKlOgA6

When Dems passed the American Rescue Plan without a single GOP vote, they allocated hundreds of millions for “modernization” of these databases to track vax rates. 

They provided 0 instructions for how states were supposed to use the money, including protecting your privacy.
This is how states have known how much vaccines to order under Operation Warp Speed, and how counties know what percent of their population is vaccinated

IISs provide *aggregate* data on a *population level* to measure the number of people within a given population who have been vaccinated. 

Like Breitbart reported, IISs *already exist* in all 50 states. There is no new vaccine database created by this bill.

As Breitbart reported,

Immunization Information Systems (IISs) “have been around for decades, operate in all 50 states, and ‘help providers and families by consolidating immunization information into one reliable source.’”
https://t.co/BszYQbrfgS

Here are the facts:

1. There’s no new database

2. This puts restrictions -like anonymity- on Biden Admin money that’s already out the door

3. Without this bill, there’d be no guardrails 

4. R’s who voted no voted *against* restrictions on how the gov’t tracks vax status.

Unfortunately, many Republicans you trust are lying to you. They want you to believe they stood strong against a “new vaccine database.” But they’re lying. There’s no new database. We just made current databases secure against federal gov’t tracking.

Here’s the truth. THREAD https://t.co/Ujnwjucq2E

Bottom line: the left’s climate argument is built on lies.

They lie about the power capacity of solar and wind.

They lie about real solutions to reducing emissions like natural gas and nuclear.

And they lie about the risks posed by climate change. 

Don’t listen to them.

Remember - Joe Biden and Democrats in Congress actually want the United States to follow Europe’s lead when it comes to climate policy. 

They’re trying to pass European-style environment policies right now in BBB.

And while Germany is facing an emissions increase, they’re also facing a big financial challenge.

Germany’s auditors found they  must spend an additional $600B over 5 years to stabilize the grid, and that “the energy transition will endanger Germany as a business location.”
Meanwhile, Germany is closing nuclear plants, the only base load power source that is emissions free, which will result in more use of coal and thus increase carbon emissions.

This is what happens when you put an over reliance on weather-dependent power sources, like wind.

When the weather doesn’t cooperate, you need to ramp up production in carbon-intensive energy sources like coal.

German coal power plants increased by 44% this year.

This obsession with solar and wind isn’t just irrational financially, it actually might lead to *more* emissions.

In Germany, where they’ve tried and failed with their own version of the Green New Deal, emissions are actually increasing.
https://t.co/0Tvn4fKnSK

The reason for these dire financial predictions are simple:

“renewables are not getting that much cheaper, decarbonization  is very hard, and the price for trying to achieve it means real hardship”
https://t.co/HTnl2cEFdc
On the fiscal implications, the documents say the cost of moving towards net zero could mean tax rises because of “the erosion of tax revenue from fossil fuel-related activity”.

On the risk of costs to companies from green initiatives, the documents say: “Climate action in the UK can lead to economic activity moving abroad if it directly leads to costs increasing, and it is more profitable to produce in countries with less stringent climate policies.”

Financial institutions are debunking this lie across the world, too.

In the UK, their Treasury warned that the greatest financial risks aren’t coming from climate change, but from *climate policy* and the obsession with transitioning to renewables.
https://t.co/mbYdi3YoyB

But the real kicker is at the end, where the Fed report states that “potential transition risks from climate change warrant *more* attention than physical disaster risks.”

Here is the full study:
https://t.co/jnuFVAAeN3

Examining FEMA disasters from 1995 to 2018, the Fed found “insignificant or small effects on U.S. banks’ performance.”

The Fed notes the findings “are generally consistent with the few papers that study the bank stability effects” of climate change.

Biden recently said climate change is an “increasing threat to U.S. financial stability.”

A new Fed report finds that banks aren’t threatened by climate change, contrary to Biden’s claims.
https://t.co/bS3z6JHJyR

Joe Biden’s radical climate policies are based on lies like “you can power the entire economy with wind and solar” or “fossil fuels are evil.”

It’s also based on another lie: “climate change poses an existential risk to global financial stability.”

We know that’s untrue. THREAD
